Description: Upper body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora; exterior: black-figure sphinx to left (lock of hair in added red, wing with band of dots in added white, red and white feathers and part of body remaining).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 132, no. 29)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 88, pl. X, no. 19.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.024) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
